title: Launch Roundup: Vega set to be retired; Polaris Dawn set for new launch attempt
summary: This week, rockets will launch from all over the globe. To start the week, China’s CASC is sending a Chang Zheng 4B on what could be its 50th successful mission. The final launch of Arianespace’s Vega rocket is set to take place on Tuesday, and Polaris Dawn is expected to launch four private astronauts to low-Earth orbit, during which the world’s first private EVA out of Crew Dragon will take place.

title: Watch Sentinel-2C launch live on the final Vega rocket
summary: The Copernicus Sentinel-2C satellite is ready for liftoff! Tune in to ESA WebTV on 4 September from 03:30 CEST to watch the satellite soar into space on the last Vega rocket to be launched from Europe’s Spaceport in Kourou, French Guiana. Sentinel-2C is scheduled to liftoff at 03:50 CEST.

title: Sentinel-2C: ready for liftoff
summary: Sentinel-2C is ready for launch! The new satellite will soon join its Copernicus Sentinel-2 family in orbit – where it will continue to provide detailed views of Earth’s land and coastal waters.

title: Arianespace CEO Declines to Comment on How Avio Replaced Vega Propellants Tanks
summary: Arianespace CEO Stéphane Israël declined to comment when asked what solution Avio had employed to replace a pair of out-of-production propellant tanks for the final Vega rocket launch. In December 2023, European Spaceflight reported that Avio had lost two of four propellant tanks that were to be used aboard the fourth stage of the final […]

title: Sentinel-2C pre-launch media briefing
summary: The Copernicus Sentinel-2C satellite is set for liftoff on 4 September on the last Vega rocket from Europe’s Spaceport in Kourou, French Guiana.

title: Sentinel-2C in the Vega launch tower
summary: Sentinel-2C in the Vega launch tower

title: Sentinel-2C sealed in the Vega rocket fairing
summary: As preparations continue to launch the Copernicus Sentinel-2C satellite on 4 September, the team at Europe’s Spaceport in Kourou, French Guiana, has bid farewell to their precious satellite as it was sealed from view within the Vega rocket fairing.

title: Arianespace Announce Sept. 3 Launch Date for Final Vega Flight
summary: Launch services provider Arianespace has announced that it expects to conduct the final Vega rocket launch on 3 September from the Guiana Space Centre. The mission will carry the Sentinel 2C Earth observation satellite to orbit for the European Commission. Arianespace is currently working towards transitioning to the upgraded Avio-built Vega C rocket. While Vega […]

title: Sentinel-2C arrives in French Guiana
summary: The Sentinel-2C satellite, the third Copernicus Sentinel-2 satellite, has arrived at the European spaceport in French Guiana for liftoff on the final Vega rocket in September. Sentinel-2C, like its predecessors, will continue to provide high-quality data for Copernicus – the Earth observation component of the EU Space Programme.
